Pre-Game Insights: India will continue to be without their key opener, Shubman Gill, who is still to get fit from a bout of dengue.
The belief will obviously be that the Men in Blue will be heading to the game with an unchanged XI from that against Australia, with the onus on the top order to get back into form.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India has won the last six ODIs out of the seven that have been hosted at the Arun Jaitley Stadium since 2005.
The surface has its own bag of tricks when it comes to batting. With 29 ODIs being played, 14 of them have been won batting first while 14 of them have been won batting second.
Others: The match will be played at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi on 11th October, 2023, at 2:00 PM.
